# Building and Trade Inspections

Building and trade (mechanical, electrical, and plumbing) inspections are required by state law to ensure construction meets current codes, and it is the permit holder’s responsibility to schedule these inspections. To improve efficiency, Fairfax County conducts combination inspections, where all related inspections for a project—such as concealment and final inspections—must be scheduled on the same day. Failing to bundle inspections properly may result in a failed inspection and a reinspection fee. Scheduling inspections at key stages of the project helps ensure safety and compliance.

Schedule, Change or Cancel an Inspection in PLUS

_**Remember:** To request an inspection for the next business day, you must submit your request in PLUS prior to 11:59 p.m. If the inspection is scheduled without the work being complete, it could result in a reinspection fee._

All inspection notifications will be sent to the applicant and the onsite contact(s). An email is sent the morning of a scheduled inspection identifying a two hour window of arrival, the inspector's name and phone number. The results will be sent to the same contact(s) after the inspection has been conducted.

_**Note:** Inspectors cannot take a call while driving or during an inspection, so please leave a message and your inspector will call you back._

**Watch Video for Instructions on Scheduling an Inspection in PLUS:**

## VIRTUAL INSPECTIONS

Fairfax County building inspections are operating by virtual and in-person inspections. Request a virtual/remote inspection by typing your preferred method into the **"Optional Comments or Instructions for your Inspector"** field while scheduling your inspection online.

County inspectors can arrange your remote inspection during their day. You must be prepared to use your mobile device’s camera to show the inspector the areas of construction ready for inspection. Be prepared to verify the address of the property using your device. Video inspections are at the discretion of the inspector and may not be possible in all cases.

## 

Inspection Programs/Processes

##  Third Party Inspections Program 

The **Third Party Inspections Program** allows private-sector inspections firms to perform inspections of residential projects that would otherwise be conducted by the county.

  * How the Program Works



The **Third Party Foundation Program** allows a pre-approved private-sector firm to inspect foundation inspection types on residential projects.

  * Request and Submission Form



##  Special Inspections Program 

The Special Inspections Program monitors all **major** commercial and residential construction projects.

  * Process, Forms and Publication



##  Elevator Program 

Existing elevators/escalators require additional periodic inspections, testing and county-acceptance to ensure these critical systems continue to function properly over their lifetime.

##  Cross Connections & Backflow Prevention Program 

Backflow preventers require periodic inspections, testing and county-acceptance to ensure these critical systems continue to function properly over their lifetime.

  * _Cross Connections Control& Backflow Prevention Program_



##  Electrical Underground Certification Form 

Inspection certification for electrical work in parking lots, ditches, trenches, and concrete construction elements in non-residential construction and **excluding swimming pools and hazardous locations**.

The master electrician must provide this information prior to scheduling the final inspection.

##  Sewer Video Submission 

Sewer submission videos are required for the following:

  * New Single Family homes built that wish to reuse the existing lateral.
  * Replacement of a lateral via “pipe bursting” means.
  * Before and after an approved Cured in Place Pipe (CIPP) liner installation.
  * As requested by an inspector.



The required Sewer Video will be uploaded through PLUS as an attachment, by the Applicant, on the associated Plumbing record. The video will be required to be uploaded and approved prior to receiving a Passed Final inspection.

##  After-Hour Electrical Inspection 

After Hours inspections will be processed through PLUS. Login to your account and find your associated record for which you want to schedule the After Hours inspection.

  * Under **My Records** , make sure they record has been issued and **select the record**.
  * Select **Make changes**
  * Select **After hours Inspection**
  * Fill out the required information
  * Application will be sent to permit staff to assess the fees
  * Applicant will receive notification to pay the assessed fees
  * Inspection staff will assign inspection to inspector



## Residential Use Permits (RUP) Requests

Often referred to as a Certificate of Occupancy, the RUP inspection is requested by email **no later than 12 p.m. the day prior to the inspection**. The request shall include the requester’s name, phone number, address and permit number.

NonResidential Use Permits (NonRUP) Requests are requested differently.

  


## What is Needed During the Inspection

Ladders, scaffolds and other equipment necessary to access construction must be provided to the inspector.

Please ensure the approved building plans, site-related plan and shop drawings are also on site and available.

  


##  PLUS Applications 

  * Log into PLUS 
  * LDS PLUS Support
  * YouTube Help Videos



  
Need Help? Call **703-222-0801** , **TTY 711**.

Monday through Thursday from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. and Friday from 9:15 a.m. to 4 p.m.

  * LDS Permit Library: Access guides to navigate every record type in PLUS.
  * Letters to Industry: Subscribe for LDS announcements, notices, and tech bulletins.
  * Meet With Staff: Find a staff member to help you with the permit process.

metadata.description: Fairfax County, Virginia - Building, mechanical, plumbing and electrical inspections are required by state law to ensure new construction complies with the Virginia Uniform Statewide Building Code.
